attributes.action: Ban ALL formulas on public sale that contain microbeads.
attributes.background: The government is banning the use of microbeads in "Rinse off" products. The cosmetic companies complain that to reformulate all their products which contain microbeads would mean changing 90% of their formulas. So government's ban only covers 10% of the use of microbeads.

attributes.action: Expel Venezuelan Diplomats and close their Embassy in London
attributes.background: Venezuela is acting like a rogue state. Its citizens are being denied their basic rights and it’s been linked with narco-trafficking and the sales of passports to the black market. Due to the economic meltdown in Venezuela there is a high risk to UK citizens allowing Venezuelan diplomats in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Venezuelan Diplomats should be expelled and the Embassy in London closed to avoid risk to the UK:

https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/venezuela/terrorism 

https://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episode/b090fb4z/hardtalk-isaias-medina-minister-counsellor-of-venezuela-to-the-un-20152017 

http://edition.cnn.com/2017/04/07/americas/venezuela-government-workers-syrian-passport-sales/index.html 

https://www.europarltv.europa.eu/programme/world/sakharov-prize-2017-venezuela-s-opposition-in-a-crisis-struck-country

attributes.action: Condemn Israeli Army killings of 30 unarmed Palestinian protestors in Gaza
attributes.background: On Friday 30th March this year Palestinians living in the Gaza Strip gathered at various points along the border with Israel to peacefully protest the blockade and demand their right of return to homes that they had been driven out of in 1948 during the Nakba. Now 30 are dead and 1000+ injured.
attributes.additional_details: The 1948 Palestinian exodus, also known as the Nakba, literally "disaster", "catastrophe", or "cataclysm"), occurred when more than 700,000 Palestinian Arabs fled or were expelled from their homes, during the 1948 Palestine war. Between 400 and 600 Palestinian villages were sacked during the war, while urban Palestine was almost entirely extinguished. The term "nakba" also refers to the period of war itself and events affecting Palestinians from December 1947 to January 1949

attributes.action: Require shops to make all aisles wide enough for wheelchairs, scooters and prams
attributes.background: Stores are packed with as many goods as possible, regardless of the store size. Unfortunately, this means the aisle space between goods can be very small. For those in wheelchairs, using scooters, or pushing a pram, this proves to be a real problem. This is an example of indirect discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: Small aisle space can be perceived as being off-putting, embarrassing and offensive for those who are unable to move through the space with ease. This not only can have a negative impact on a personal level, but also on the store itself as some may be put off from shopping there again. We do not tend to have this issue with supermarkets due to their traditional layout of wide aisles. This petition hopes to raise awareness, whilst asking for policy to be introduced to tackle the problem.

attributes.action: Issue British passports without the EU logo.
attributes.background: As the British people voted to leave the EU on 23 June 2016 and will be entirely out by March 2019, stop issuing British passports with the EU logo immediately and give people the option to exchange a passport with an EU logo for one without an EU logo, for a small fee.

attributes.action: Install ‘donation stations’ at a&e/hospital entrances/exits for people to use
attributes.background:
The NHS provide an amazing service, yet are always getting budget cuts. 

Install machines at hospital entrances and exits in which people can leave a donation if they wish, cash or card (contactless).

Use this to top up the NHS budget as a whole, or let hospitals use how they need to.
attributes.additional_details: Many people leave hospital thinking how can I thank the NHS for their help. I certainly have on our several a&e visits over the last few years. Installing a donation station would help people to feel they are giving thanks whilst helping our NHS through the tough cuts they face. The cost of installing would of course be covered in no time with donations received then start generating profit for the NHS.

attributes.action: To grant 6yr old epilepsy sufferer Alfie Dingley a licence for medical cannabis.
attributes.background: The Home Office need to act to grant 6yr old epilepsy sufferer Alfie Dingley a licence for medical cannabis. He was treated with it in Holland and his seizures reduced from 150 to 1 seizure a month. Alfie should not have to break the law to access his medicine. He needs this medicine to live.
attributes.additional_details: Alfie is 1 of 9 of nine boys in the world who suffer from PCH19. Without this licence from the Home Office to use medicinal cannabis Alfie's seizures will return to over 150 a month each requiring hospitalisation. He will not have the quality of life he deserves. The only treatment he responds to in the UK causes psychosis, organ damage and early death. The family should not have to accept this. The licence should be granted, Alfie is a patient not a criminal. He needs access to his medicine.

attributes.action: Make "Jerusalem" England's official national anthem by law
attributes.background: Two years ago, a bill passed the first reading backing the call to consider an official national anthem for the nation of England to be played for major UK and Commonwealth events. This petition builds on that bill, and humbly asks to make 'Jerusalem' the official national anthem of England.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-derbyshire-35296296, "MPs back calls for English national anthem". BBC News. London: BBC. 13 January 2016.

https://services.parliament.uk/bills/2015-16/englishnationalanthem.html, English National Anthem Bill 2015-16.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rT1HEXNI9c4, 'Jerusalem', the song in question.

attributes.action: Halt the rollout of fingerprint scanners to police
attributes.background: The Home Office is beginning a trial of new fingerprint scanners with West Yorkshire Police. These scanners connect to an app on a police officer's phone, allowing quick checking of the person's fingerprints against criminal and immigration databases. This has not had any parliamentary scrutiny.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/government/news/police-trial-new-home-office-mobile-fingerprint-technology

https://www.liberty-human-rights.org.uk/news/blog/why-its-not-okay-police-quietly-roll-out-spot-fingerprint-scanning

attributes.action: Erect a statue of Nye Bevan in the Houses of Parliament celebrating the NHS.
attributes.background: The founder of the greatest achievment this country has witnessed should be recognised, by a statue in the houses of parliament.

attributes.action: All schools to offer optional sessions so children can learn about growing food
attributes.background:
In the UK we've a proud heritage in the growing of our food. Be it on farms, allotments or in our gardens. 

Sadly though, many children haven't had the pleasure of harvesting their own veg for their plate. 

We feel that children need access to areas to experience growing food for themselves.

attributes.action: Make the waiting lists for NHS gender identity clinics shorter
attributes.background: I’m a trans young person with mental health difficulties & I’m currently on a 2 year waiting list for a gender identity clinic. I feel like this waiting time is detrimental to my mental health difficulties & the long waiting time isn’t fair on myself or other trans people experiencing the same thing
attributes.additional_details: Long waiting times for specialist treatment can not only cause someone with gender dysphoria to go downhill, but it can be so frustrating and upsetting for trans people and their families. It takes a lot of courage to come out as trans and the long waiting times make us feel unimportant. Feeling as if you’re in the wrong body and being so desperate to change is really challenging and I feel like we should be able access support sooner.

attributes.action: Make primary schools exempt from ancient heraldry laws.
attributes.background: The Lord Lyon King of Arms act 1672 is an outdated law requiring registration of coats of arms. Schools which have used logos for years which unknowingly contravened these laws are being asked to pay the £1800 registration fee which could be better used for resources and services to aid education.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.thecourier.co.uk/fp/news/local/perth-kinross/655625/perth-pupils-told-to-raise-almost-2000-for-school-crest-following-legal-dispute/

The 300 year old law is unnecessary for primary schools and parents and teachers are facing the difficult decision to either change the logo or pay the fee through fundraising. Both outcomes resulting in cost implications and a waste of money, time and resources. Small schools should be made exempt.

attributes.action: Stop funding the BBC with taxpayer money
attributes.background: The BBC does not represent the public fairly anymore, it is a biased Corporation that is over funded with taxpayer money.

attributes.action: Amend Representation of the Peoples act 1983 to include Social Media campaigns.
attributes.background: Where transparency and fairness within elections is said to be valued within western democracies and is enshrined in British law, social media is being used to undermine these principles and laws, meaning the current law is therefore clearly outdated and unfit for purpose.
attributes.additional_details: S.110 of the Representation of the Peoples act 1983 states that "an imprint must be added to printed election material. The electoral commission's advice on social media surrounding imprint offences however is as follows; "With the increased use of social hi-tech media there are an increasing number of allegations being made in relation to electronic material; however there is no imprint requirement here. The Electoral Commission recommends that the imprint should be provided as good practice.”

attributes.action: Full-scale independent inquiry into mismanagement of all UK rail transport.
attributes.background: From potentially illegal treatment of passengers by train companies during the recent "Beast from the East" cold snap, through failing franchises and unjustifiable price increases, to the most recent abortive failure of the 26-30 Railcard; British railway transport is at an unacceptable nadir. Why?
attributes.additional_details:
Why were passengers not evacuated for 15 hours? Or provided with food, water, or blankets for 15 hours?
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-5453487/Passengers-stuck-train-no-heating-toilets-15-HOURS.html

Why did Southeastern ignore their own health and safety legislation? Who will ensure this doesn't happen again?
http://buzzsteam.com/2018/03/04/southeastern-commuter-train-stuck-at-lewisham/

Is incompetent mismanagement of our trains putting members of the public at unnecessary risk?

attributes.action: Mandatory for all hospital theatres to evacuate diathermy  tissue smoke plume.
attributes.background: Despite having risk assessments,some surgeons are reluctant to use smoke evacuation, which puts perioperative staff and patients at a risk of breathing in harmful diathermy tissue smoke.
attributes.additional_details:
Diathermy smoke called plaque, is also carcinogenic and mutagenic and even contains hydrogen cyanide.One gram of diathermy tissue is equal to smoking six (6) unfiltered cigarettes.

I want the government to make diathermy smoke evacuation a compulsory requirement rather than a recommendation.

http://ortoday.com/the-real-risks-surgical-smoke/

attributes.action: Require winter tyres on all vehicles from 1st November to 31st March each year
attributes.background: Reduce risk of accidents on roads in winter conditions. Motorists stuck on the motorways in winter like on the M74 16th-17th Jan 2018 less likely. Uncleared roads generally still passable. Makes the roads safer for those who use winter tyres already.

attributes.action: Introduce a license for dogs and cats to combat the stray animal/ shelter crisis
attributes.background: Further action must be brought in for owners, in order to prevent flippant animal purchases and irresponsible, unlicensed breeding. Sadly, charities are overflowing with pets; not enough responsibility is being taken by the owner- microchips just aren't enough, especially when details are outdated.
attributes.additional_details: According to the RSPCA Facts and Figures, investigators deal with over 149,000 calls annually in regards to cruelty and neglect as well as rescuing 129,602 animals but only re-homing 47,000. Sadly the Animal Welfare Act 2007 is not enough for ensuring responsible ownership due to the rise in popularity for designer dogs like pugs and huskies. Battersea Dogs and Cats Home are seeing more dogs and cats due to being an unwanted present or unable to pay for health issues.

attributes.action: Investigate the destruction of Windrush records by the Home Office.
attributes.background:
The Home office said that these documents were disposed of under the Data Protection Act. The result has been thousands of people effectively being made stateless and some being deported. 
There are reports of what happened and of staff raising concerns at the time and being overruled.
attributes.additional_details:
The Windrush generation like millions of immigrants from around the world brought their families here, settled and made a massive contribution to British life. 
 
This government appears to have set out to strip them of their rights by changing the law without debate and disposing of the records. 
 
Shredding historical records that effectively remove rights from British citizens is an appalling abuse of power. 
 
It must be investigated!

attributes.action: Consider extenuating circumstances when determining maximum uni maintenance loan
attributes.background: University maintenance costs are expensive. Whilst loans are allocated according to household income, this policy assumes that parents are willing to help out their child with payments - something not all parents are willing to do, preventing students from doing well in or even attending university.
attributes.additional_details: I want the government to allow for students in such situations to appeal for a greater maintenance loan. It is considered unfair that students wanting to carry on their education should be held back due to their financial backgrounds, and I would argue that this too is affected by the willingness of parents to support their children. Everyone wanting to go to university should be given the opportunity to do so, and this includes maximising support for students who will struggle with living costs!

attributes.action: Legislation ensuring airlines must seat vulnerable people with their guardians
attributes.background: When booking a flight it should be guaranteed within the price that vulnerable people and young children are seated with their parent/guardian/carer and not exposed to risk of harm by separation on the plane. Protection of children is a right & not a privilege that can be purchased as an "add on"
attributes.additional_details: Airlines are exploiting a human right for vulnerable people to be protected by charging additional for seat allocation on a first come first served basis  and are avoiding responsibility for the safety of ALL passengers. Inevitably a vulnerable person will be abused, assaulted , bullied on an airline and the question asked will be "why were families or vulnerable separated". With modern booking systems there is no reason why seat allocation can't be made within the price in the first instance

attributes.action: Not introduce photo Identification to vote.
attributes.background: Bromley is taking part in a Voter ID "PILOT" at the Local Council Elections on 3 May 2018. This means that Bromley voters must produce ID to vote at a polling station. They will be asked to show one form of photographic ID from a list which includes a passport, photo driving license. BBC
attributes.additional_details: My grown-up children do not directly pay bills. Only 2 drive, my partner and I do not, and this is the case for many people. I don’t see why anyone should have to apply for a passport as it will soon be a less useful document and/or may not be going abroad. Many will not be able to afford one putting a price on the right to vote. Nor should they be left waiting for one to enable them to exercise their democratic right

attributes.action: Refund Road Fund License for 4x4 Vehicles
attributes.background: Make a provision for 4x4 Vehicle Owners to obtain a refund against their Road Fund License where they have Volunteered their time, Vehicle and resources during the recent weather crisis
attributes.additional_details:
Over the last week, most of the UK has been battered by winter storms which have left thousands of people stranded, and thousands of essential workers unable to do their jobs. 

Ordinary people. Care workers, School teachers, NHS staff, shop workers, delivery drivers...Thousands of people. 

Into this mess have stepped hundreds if not thousands of 4x4 drivers who have freely given their time to venture out in the worst of the weather to rescue those stranded. 

This army of 4x4 drivers has kept so much of this country moving in the last week, do you think it out of place for a very public “Thank You” from the government?

attributes.action: Stop extradition to the UAE
attributes.background: No Brit has been extradited from the UK to the UAE since 2010, but growing extradition requests from the UAE incur millions of pounds in costs for the UK taxpayer. The UK must suspend or withdraw from the extradition treaty with the UAE until the UAE can uphold human rights.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government is aware of – and holds - extensive and reliable evidence of human rights violations in the UAE. This includes evidence from British lawyer David Haigh, who was imprisoned without charge in Dubai for over 15 months, with no police investigation or formal interviews about the allegations against him. He was tortured and sexually abused. With others unjustly accused by the UAE, he continues to fight against extradition. http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-scotland-glasgow-west-42027115

attributes.action: Make sending unsolicited pictures of penises illegal
attributes.background: Women are being sent many unwanted photographs of penises, it is just as distressing as in the flesh which is already covered by indecent exposure laws.
attributes.additional_details: We need everyone to know that an unwanted penis is unwanted whether it is in the flesh or in a photograph. You should have a communication trail to prove it was wanted.

attributes.action: Stop Proceeds of Crime Act powers from being used in planning cases
attributes.background: Change the law to stop local authorities using powers in the Proceeds of Crime Act in planning cases. The POCA was intended to be used to seize assets of drug dealers, arms dealers etc - serious criminals. Local authorities must be prevented from using it against people for breaching planning laws.
attributes.additional_details: My family are a farming family. Due to an alleged planning infraction and an enforcement order that escalated, the powers in the Proceeds of Crime Act can be used take assets that my family has worked for all of our lives. For our assets (up to and including the family home) to be called a 'proceed of crime' is unjust, immoral and deeply unfair.

attributes.action: Don't ban single use plastic straws for disabled people.
attributes.background: People with no arms or extremely short arms, people paralysed from the neck down, people with severe arthritis,muscle wasting diseases,cerebral palsy, these are just some disabled people who NEED straws to stay hydrated, my list by no means covers every type of impairment where straws are necessary.
attributes.additional_details: Plain and simple, if you cannot use your arms then you NEED a straw. The evidence so far regarding the alternatives to plastic straws is, the biodegradable ones start degrading when you put them in a hot drink as to the wheat ones, glass ones are dangerous for those who may accidentally bite them, bamboo and other wooden types are not flexible enough, some of the alternatives also change the flavour of the drink.

attributes.action: Make crossing patrols mandatory outside schools and consistency in policing area
attributes.background: Recently we as parents have been worried about the kids crossing a main road with no patrol. Although these services are not mandatory they should be. Children can not see over the parked cars outside of schools, this then heightens the risk for children crossing the road. Consistency
attributes.additional_details: This is an issue all over in many schools and it’s down to parents really. Many parents of running late or whatever reason seem to think the yellow zigzag lines are drop off or pick up points, when in fact they are putting other children in danger. Its Time to clampdown and do something about it.we need to solve the issue make these areas mandatory to have a crossing whether it be a pelican, zebra crossing or a crossing patrol. Something needs done. More than just a fine as it’s not preventing this

attributes.action: Recognise crustaceans as animals in UK welfare legislation
attributes.background:
The UK has some of the best animal welfare laws in the world. However, the UK does not legally recognise crustaceans/decapods as animals.

Research demonstrates these animals feel pain. They should be included in the same legal protection for humane treatment as terrestrial farm animals.

attributes.action: Automatically give custodial sentences to those who steal from vulnerable people
attributes.background: I would like the Government to change the law so that people who steal from vulnerable people when they are working in a position of trust are automatically given a custodial sentence.

attributes.action: Make school food-growing (and self-sufficiency) part of the National Curriculum.
attributes.background: All schools have space for growing food & with innovative techniques such as vertical gardening, even edges of a playground can become an allotment. Invest in schools so that they can REDUCE external dependency. Off-grid futures would incl. energy generation, rain-water harvesting & recycling.
attributes.additional_details:
The larger the space available, the larger the impact on education, health & school finances. It's also time to consider deleting meat from school meals, instead invest in growing fruit & veg.

Growing minds, building healthy futures, teaching valuable life-skills, helping children embrace the outdoors - growing food at school & learning about sustainability is fun, engaging & unforgettable, an essential subject for the National Curriculum.

attributes.action: Main parents household income to be calculated and used for child maintenance
attributes.background:
Aims to stop the main parent from using their child as a monetary weapon, as seen in many cases.
There are too many cases where, for example, the mother is living a more luxurious lifestyle and does not need extra monetary support for the child. But still claims from the father who is struggling

attributes.action: Give PCV Cat D drivers Cat C (HGV) entitlement
attributes.background:
Currently there is a shortage of Cat C HGV drivers if Cat D entitled drivers were given Cat C status this would help close the shortfall. 
Cat D & C test are almost the same and the vehicles have the same characteristics in movement.

attributes.action: Vote for whether there should be another EU referendum
attributes.background: HM Government says that if there is another referendum, then Democracy is broken. Therefore, I am calling for a vote on whether another referendum should take place, which means Democracy is not broken as the people have chosen to have another referendum if it is voted for.
attributes.additional_details: This means that the government must hold another referendum as the people of the nation voted for it, and must not neglect democracy. Lies were made in the campaign for Brexit, and politicians have not been held accounted for that. I personally believe that false hope does not represent democracy and there was no transparency. Furthermore, the people did not know what they voted for and they have the right to vote again, now they understand consequences. You must ask the people to vote again.

attributes.action: Full funding for Aflibercept, Bevacizumab,Lapatinib,Eribulin, Everolimus
attributes.background: I have cancer and I believe that the drug Bevacizmab would help my treatment and it is not currently funded by the NHS.

attributes.action: Make It Law That Cyclists Have To Have Insurance
attributes.background: Cyclists can cause accidents just like other road users! They have very little patience towards people that they share both cycle and footpaths with. They should be insured!

attributes.action: Urge the Chinese government to ban the practice of killing dogs inhumanly
attributes.background:
Thousands of dogs are annually tortured to death during the Yulin Dog Meat festival. They are skinned alive, boiled to death, beaten, burned and dismembered while still alive. 

Yulin began in 2009; it is not tradition. Nor is there a valid comparison bet

attributes.action: Improve access to healthcare for homeless people
attributes.background: Homeless people are dying far too early, and of preventable illnesses, in part due to problems accessing health care which could save their lives. The government should improve provisions for such people, who are impeded from getting care due to their circumstances.
attributes.additional_details: 50% of homeless people die of disease and infection, and a further 36% die from drugs and alcohol. These deaths could be prevented through improved access to healthcare. At present, the average age of death for homeless people is 45 years in men and 43 in women. This is unacceptable and must be improved.

attributes.action: Stop providers of Buy to Let mortgages discriminating against benefits claimants
attributes.background: The housing crisis in the UK is being exacerbated by the main lenders for Buy to Let mortgages, including TSB, Santander, Virgin and NatWest, stating that landlords must not let their properties to housing benefit claimants. We call on the government to make this discriminatory practice illegal.
attributes.additional_details:
More than 120,000 children are living in temporary homes according to the public accounts committee (01/05/2017 The Times)

The number of tenants in the private sector receiving state help has risen by 50 per cent to almost 1.5 million since the financial crisis as wages stagnate and rents rise (01/05/2017

The combination of economic pressures means more and more vulnerable tenants are being pushed out of the private rented sector (Sean Tompkins, Chief Executive of Rics bbc.co.uk 09/07/2017)

attributes.action: Take all income into account when calculating for Child Maintenance payments
attributes.background: Take all income into account, including dividend payments for self-employed, when calculating child maintenance payments through the CMS from non-residential parents.  The current tax loop hold of payment through dividends is depriving children of income by not being included for CMS payments.
attributes.additional_details: When couples split up, they can select to calculate child maintenance payments privately, or to use the government's Child Maintenance Service (CMS). I ask that all forms of income are taken into account, including dividend payments for the self-employed, when calculating child maintenance payments through the CMS from non-residential parents.  The current tax loop hold of payment through dividends is depriving children of income by not being included for CMS payments.

attributes.action: End the inequality of Child Tax Credits and Child Benefit after a separation.
attributes.background: After a separation a "non-resident" parent with shared 50/50 caring is not entitled to claim Child Tax Credits easily and fairly under the current system. This is causing children to live half their lives in poverty.
attributes.additional_details: When a child is born 1 parent claims the Child Benefit. At the direct time of separation in a 50/50% contact scenario only the "resident parent" can claim the Child Tax Credit benefit due to being in receipt of the Child Benefit. End the inequality! Non-resident parents and children deserve a fairer system.

attributes.action: Examine the entire policing operation in the UK.
attributes.background: Policing has moved on. Crime is again predominating. Policing is asked to do more with ever decreasing numbers of officers. Yet the only section of the police family that is suffering is the front line. A fundamental change is needed.
attributes.additional_details: There is no longer justification for 43 constabularies with all the expenditure associated with them. We need a major re-think. Budget saved would be used to increase front line officers delivering policingthe through a streamlined, efficient leadership model. Supported financially by the sale of headquarters buildings the service can become more visual as should be the case. The knock on effect would also mean the reduction of Crime Commissioners and their entourage within a refirmed structure.

attributes.action: For the campaign #askforangela to be a government backed national roll out
attributes.background: A simple code-word campaign for people feeling unsafe on a date. It encourages people to discreetly ask for help by going to the bar and ' Ask for Angela' - a phrase aimed at alerting bar staff to the cry for help so they can help defuse the situation discretely and without fuss.
attributes.additional_details:
A woman has successfully used the ‘Ask for Angela’ safety scheme to remove herself from a difficult situation during a night out.

A number of pubs across the country offer the scheme, which aims to reduce sexual violence and vulnerability by providing men and women with a subtle phrase they can use to get out of uncomfortable or potentially dangerous circumstances.

One pub in Gloucester successfully helped a female patron to do just that.

attributes.action: Stop disabled  badge users parking on double yellows
attributes.background: Stop disabled badge users parking on double yellows and causing an obstruction to service, delivery and emergency service vehicles

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for local councils to scan deceased domestic animals
attributes.background: Make it a legal requirement for local councils to scan deceased domestic animals for chips and report to local vet to alert owners, to ensure people are aware their pet has passed away and don’t continue looking, also to raise awareness of potential animal abuse in certain boroughs
attributes.additional_details: Local council are collecting cats and dogs found and just disposing of them with other waste without any form of logging system this leads to people often looking for pets months and even years putting up flyers for animals they have no hope of finding. To support people and boroughs in identifying potential animal cruelty occurring within a borough who has excessive number of missing domesticated pets

attributes.action: To make parole board members directly culpable for the actions of those released
attributes.background: A new law is required. Parole board experts release convicts who then go on to re-offend. The public get assaulted and maimed, the experts on the parole board hide in their anonymity. If a convict is paroled and murders, then every member of that board should serve the sentence with their convict.
attributes.additional_details:
Parole boards are only accountable to themselves, not to the public. One of these is about to release "The Black Cab Rapist" after 10 years of an indeterminate sentence. This could make the public unsafe.
 
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-42571219

attributes.action: Invest more in the NHS to prevent it from being at breaking point
attributes.background: The NHS has been underfunded for years. The government has failed to address this issue. They claim that the NHS is working better than it ever has yet patient and left in hospital corridors for hours with out a bed!
attributes.additional_details: The NHS is facing the worst winter in its 70 year history. They are seeing more people than ever before. As a results all hospitals in England have cancelled all routine operations and appointments so staff can help in A&E departments. Many hospitals have declared critical alert the highest level because of the unprecedented demand on the services. The government is saying there is nothing wrong and the NHS is operating normally! The NHS desperately needs emergency crash push to help recover.

attributes.action: Fund free vet care for people who can't afford it
attributes.background: I feel that hospitals are charging people a lot of money for pet care, some people can't afford. I lost my beloved pet who I consider to be my child because of the high costs of treatment.
attributes.additional_details: My pet was suffering from meningitis.

attributes.action: Include Paediatric First Aid Training in the ante-natal classes for new parents
attributes.background: There have been many situations where trained parents have saved their babies life but there’s also one to many cases where a baby has been lost because parents were lost in despair not knowing to take action. Knowing CPR is critical and all new parents should know how to save the baby if needed be.
attributes.additional_details: Many parents have taken their sad stories to social media to warn other parents of potential risks and advised them to take a CPR course
